text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Iraqi press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- U.N. secretary-general lauds relations with Iraq
- Foreign minister meets U.N. officials in New York to expedite arrival of food to Iraq
- Oil minister says Iraq's crude flows to markets smoothly
- (The above were also carried by AL-IRAQ and JUMHOURIYA)
- Iraqi general who took part in 1991 Gulf War over Kuwait says United States and allies were forced to accept ceasefire under pressure from Iraq's elite force of Republican Guards
- Citizens urged to rationalise consumption of power
- Editorial attacks Libyan leader for remarks blaming Iraq for the 1991 invasion of Kuwait
- National Assembly debates private sector participation in oil industry
- Saudi Arabia cannot balance its budget and curtail expenditures
